description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人，曾任中共中央政治局常委，主管意识形态工作。他在主政河南期间，因推行“血浆经济”而导致艾滋病大规模爆发而备受争议。
description.en: A former senior leader of the Chinese Communist Party and the People's Republic of China, who served as a member of the Politburo Standing Committee of the CCP Central Committee, in charge of ideology. He is controversial for the large-scale AIDS outbreak caused by the promotion of a 'plasma economy' during his tenure in Henan.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国哈尔滨市的著名理工科大学，李长春的母校。
description.en: A renowned university of science and engineering located in Harbin, China, and the alma mater of Li Changchun.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在河南省的领导机关。
description.en: The leading organ of the Chinese Communist Party in Henan Province.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国河南省的省级国家行政机关。
description.en: The provincial state administrative organ of Henan Province, People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在广东省的领导机关。
description.en: The leading organ of the Chinese Communist Party in Guangdong Province.

description.zh-cn: 前中共中央总书记，曾考虑将李长春选为国务院总理的接班人。
description.en: Former General Secretary of the CCP Central Committee who once considered Li Changchun as a successor for the Premier of the State Council.

description.zh-cn: 前中华人民共和国国务院总理，反对李长春作为其接班人。
description.en: Former Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China who opposed Li Changchun as his successor.

description.zh-cn: 前中华人民共和国国务院总理，在与李长春的竞争中胜出，成为朱镕基的接班人。
description.en: Former Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China who won the competition against Li Changchun to become Zhu Rongji's successor.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央政治局常务委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央政治局常务委员会
en: Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的最高领导机构。
description.en: The highest leadership body of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，李长春的前任中央精神文明建设指导委员会主任。
description.en: Chinese politician and Li Changchun's predecessor as Director of the Central Guidance Commission on Building Spiritual Civilization.

nodes.id: 中央精神文明建设指导委员会

zh-cn: 中央精神文明建设指导委员会
en: Central Guidance Commission on Building Spiritual Civilization

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的议事协调机构，负责全国意识形态和精神文明建设工作。
description.en: A deliberation and coordination body of the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party, responsible for nationwide ideological and spiritual civilization construction work.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，曾任李长春在中央精神文明建设指导委员会的副手，并接替其主任职务。据称他也是向谷歌施压的主要协调人。
description.en: Chinese politician who served as Li Changchun's deputy on the Central Guidance Commission on Building Spiritual Civilization and later succeeded him as director. He was also allegedly the main coordinator of pressure on Google.

description.zh-cn: 指搜索引擎公司谷歌因遭受黑客攻击及内容审查问题，于2010年宣布停止在中国大陆的搜索服务审查，并将服务器移至香港的事件。据称该事件由李长春和周永康主导。
description.en: Refers to the event in 2010 where the search engine company Google announced it would stop censoring its search services in mainland China and move its servers to Hong Kong, following hacking attacks and content censorship issues. The event was allegedly directed by Li Changchun and Zhou Yongkang.

description.zh-cn: 由谷歌公司推出的一个互联网搜索引擎。
description.en: An internet search engine provided by Google.

description.zh-cn: 前中共中央政治局常委，据称与李长春共同主导了谷歌退出中国事件。
description.en: Former member of the Politburo Standing Committee of the CCP Central Committee, who allegedly co-directed the Google withdrawal incident with Li Changchun.

description.zh-cn: 时任谷歌中国总裁，他曾断言，要求审查谷歌中文网的压力根源是李长春。
description.en: Then-president of Google China, who asserted that the root of the pressure to censor Google's Chinese site was Li Changchun.

description.zh-cn: 指1990年代中国河南省因不规范的采血、输血活动，特别是政府推动的“血浆经济”，导致艾滋病等传染病大规模传播的公共卫生灾难。时任河南省领导的李长春被认为应负主要责任。
description.en: Refers to the public health disaster in Henan Province, China, in the 1990s, where non-standard blood collection and transfusion practices, especially the government-promoted 'plasma economy', led to the widespread transmission of infectious diseases such as AIDS. Li Changchun, the leader of Henan at the time, is considered to bear the main responsibility.

description.zh-cn: 前河南省卫生厅长，被认为与李长春一同对河南血祸负有主要责任。
description.en: Former Director of the Henan Provincial Health Department, considered to be jointly responsible with Li Changchun for the Henan plasma economy disaster.

description.zh-cn: 原中国健康教育研究所所长，曾发表公开信指责李长春在河南血祸中的责任。
description.en: Former director of the China Health Education Research Institute, who published an open letter criticizing Li Changchun's responsibility in the Henan plasma economy disaster.

description.zh-cn: 李长春的妻子，高级工程师。
description.en: Li Changchun's wife, a senior engineer.

description.zh-cn: 李长春的长子，曾任中国移动副总裁。
description.en: Li Changchun's eldest son, former vice president of China Mobile.

description.zh-cn: 李长春的长女，中银国际执行总裁。
description.en: Li Changchun's eldest daughter, executive president of BOC International.

description.zh-cn: 李长春的次女。
description.en: Li Changchun's second daughter.

description.zh-cn: 中国的国有电信公司之一。
description.en: One of China's state-owned telecommunications companies.

description.zh-cn: 中国的投资银行。
description.en: An investment bank in China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，在李长春任中共广东省委书记期间担任常务副省长，协助处理国企问题。
description.en: Chinese politician who served as Executive Vice Governor during Li Changchun's tenure as Guangdong Provincial Party Secretary, assisting in handling issues of state-owned enterprises.

description.zh-cn: 中共元老，其家族势力在广东曾有巨大影响，后被李长春压制。
description.en: A CCP elder whose family's influence was significant in Guangdong before being suppressed by Li Changchun.

description.zh-cn: 历史上日本在中国辽东半岛的租借地，是李长春的出生地。
description.en: A historical Japanese leased territory in China's Liaodong Peninsula, and the birthplace of Li Changchun.

description.zh-cn: 李长春于1961年至1966年在哈尔滨工业大学电机工程系工业企业自动化专业学习。
description.en: Li Changchun studied in the Industrial Enterprise Automation major of the Electrical Engineering Department at Harbin Institute of Technology from 1961 to 1966.

description.zh-cn: 李长春于1965年9月加入中国共产党。
description.en: Li Changchun joined the Chinese Communist Party in September 1965.

relationships.target: 中国共产党中央政治局常务委员会
中央精神文明建设指导委员会

description.zh-cn: 时任中共中央总书记江泽民一度考虑将李长春选为时任国务院总理朱镕基的接班人。
description.en: Then-General Secretary Jiang Zemin once considered selecting Li Changchun as the successor to then-Premier Zhu Rongji.

description.zh-cn: 朱镕基不希望李长春作为其国务院总理的接班人，并借由2000年汕头地区的走私案件来阻止李长春接任总理。
description.en: Zhu Rongji did not want Li Changchun as his successor for Premier and used a smuggling case in the Shantou area in 2000 to prevent Li from taking over the position.

description.zh-cn: 李长春与温家宝曾是朱镕基总理接班人的竞争对手，最终温家宝胜出。
description.en: Li Changchun and Wen Jiabao were rivals for the succession to Premier Zhu Rongji, with Wen Jiabao ultimately succeeding.

description.zh-cn: 李长春于2002年11月接替丁关根出任中央精神文明建设指导委员会主任。
description.en: In November 2002, Li Changchun succeeded Ding Guangen as the Director of the Central Guidance Commission on Building Spiritual Civilization.

description.zh-cn: 李长春于2013年1月18日卸任中央精神文明建设指导委员会主任，由刘云山接任。
description.en: Li Changchun stepped down as the Director of the Central Guidance Commission on Building Spiritual Civilization on January 18, 2013, and was succeeded by Liu Yunshan.

description.zh-cn: 据维基解密引述的美国外交密电，谷歌退出中国事件是由李长春和周永康一手主导的。
description.en: According to US diplomatic cables cited by WikiLeaks, the event of Google's withdrawal from China was directed by Li Changchun and Zhou Yongkang.

description.zh-cn: 据维基解密引述的美国外交密电，谷歌退出中国事件是由李长春和周永康一手主导的。
description.en: According to US diplomatic cables cited by WikiLeaks, the event of Google's withdrawal from China was directed by Li Changchun and Zhou Yongkang.

description.zh-cn: 据称，李长春因在谷歌搜索上发现对自己的批评链接，而决意打压其在中国的业务，并下令国营电信公司停止与谷歌的业务往来。
description.en: It is alleged that Li Changchun decided to suppress Google's business in China after finding critical links about himself on Google Search, and ordered state-owned telecommunications companies to cease business with Google.

description.zh-cn: 时任谷歌中国总裁李开复断言，要求审查谷歌中文网的压力根源是李长春。
description.en: Kai-Fu Lee, then-president of Google China, asserted that the root of the pressure to censor Google's Chinese site was Li Changchun.

description.zh-cn: 李长春主政河南期间，号召“要想奔小康，赶紧卖血浆”，其推行的“血浆经济”政策被认为是导致艾滋病疫情泛滥的主要原因。
description.en: During Li Changchun's tenure in Henan, he promoted the slogan 'To get rich, sell your blood plasma.' His 'plasma economy' policy is considered the main cause of the AIDS epidemic.

description.zh-cn: 时任河南省卫生厅长刘全喜与省领导李长春被认为应对河南血祸共同担当主要责任。
description.en: Liu Quanxi, then Director of the Henan Provincial Health Department, is considered to share primary responsibility with provincial leader Li Changchun for the Henan plasma economy disaster.

description.zh-cn: 原卫生部官员陈秉中发表公开信，指控李长春应对河南血祸负责。
description.en: Former Ministry of Health official Chen Bingzhong published an open letter accusing Li Changchun of being responsible for the Henan plasma economy disaster.

description.zh-cn: 李长春任中共广东省委书记期间，王岐山任常务副省长，并协助李长春处理国有企业问题。
description.en: While Li Changchun was Secretary of the Guangdong Provincial Party Committee, Wang Qishan served as Executive Vice Governor and assisted Li in handling issues with state-owned enterprises.

description.zh-cn: 李长春在广东执政期间，压制和清洗了叶剑英家族在当地的政治势力。
description.en: During his tenure in Guangdong, Li Changchun suppressed and purged the political influence of Ye Jianying's family in the region.
